title: üö® URGENT: Disable Vercel Password Protection - Site Inaccessible

context.problem: Vercel deployment returning 401 Unauthorized - password protection enabled
context.impact: Site is LIVE but NO ONE can access it - public gets password prompt
context.solution: Disable Vercel Deployment Protection and promote to production

required_access: Vercel dashboard access to project: fix2
Admin or Owner role in Vercel team

deployment_promotion.note: Look for most recent successful deployment

instructions: If you see 'Vercel Authentication' toggle - turn it OFF
If you see 'Password Protection' - turn it OFF
detailed_steps.critical: ALL protection must be disabled for public access

instructions: Find the most recent deployment (should be at top)
Click the '...' menu button on that deployment
detailed_steps.note: This makes the deployment live on production domain

instructions: Wait 30 seconds for changes to take effect
Vercel CDN needs time to update globally

test_commands.failure: If still 401, wait 1 more minute and retry

browser_tests.failure: If password prompt appears, protection is still enabled

browser_tests.expected: Site loads with Elevate for Humanity homepage
browser_tests.note: May take 2-5 minutes for DNS propagation

success_indicators: ‚úÖ No password prompt when visiting site
‚úÖ Public can access without Vercel login

current_problem_details.root_cause: Vercel Deployment Protection enabled on project
current_problem_details.impact: Site is deployed but inaccessible to public users

required_screenshots: Deployments page showing 'Production' badge on latest
Browser showing site loading without password prompt

no_vercel_access.solution: Contact Vercel account owner for access
no_vercel_access.escalate: Project lead must grant Vercel team access

settings_not_visible.solution: You may not have admin role - need Owner or Admin
settings_not_visible.escalate: Request role upgrade from Vercel account owner

still_401_after_disable.problem: Site still returns 401 after disabling protection
solutions: Check if latest deployment is promoted to production
Verify you saved settings in Vercel

production_domain_404.solution: No deployment assigned to production - must promote deployment
production_domain_404.action: Go to Deployments ‚Üí Click '...' ‚Üí Promote to Production

preview_urls_still_protected.solution: This is NORMAL - preview deployments can stay protected
preview_urls_still_protected.note: Only production domain needs to be public

security_notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Disabling protection makes site publicly accessible
‚ö†Ô∏è Preview deployments may stay protected (this is OK)
‚úÖ Production domain must be public for users to access
‚úÖ This is standard for public websites

activation.escalation: If not completed in 15 minutes, escalate to team lead
activation.urgency_reason: Site is deployed but completely inaccessible to public
